Generation I.Red: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.
Generation I.Yellow: Flaps its broad flower petals to scatter its poisonous pollen. The flapping sound is very loud.
Generation I.Stadium: Scatters allergy-causing pollen from its broad petals. The larger the petals, the more pollen is scattered.

Generation II.Gold: It has the world's largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.
Generation II.Silver: The bud bursts into bloom with a bang. It then starts scattering allergenic, poisonous pollen.
Generation II.Crystal: By shaking its big petals, it scatters toxic pollen into the air, turning the air yellow.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It has the world's largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) The bud bursts into bloom with a bang. It then starts scattering allergenic, poisonous pollen. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Vileplume 's toxic pollen triggers atrocious allergy attacks. That's why it is advisable never to approach any attractive flowers in a jungle, however pretty they may be.
Generation III.Sapphire: Vileplume has the world's largest petals. They are used to attract prey that are then doused with toxic spores. Once the prey are immobilized, this Pok é mon catches and devours them.
Generation III.Emerald: In seasons when it produces more pollen, the air around a Vileplume turns yellow with the powder as it walks. The pollen is highly toxic and causes paralysis.
Generation III.FireRed: Its petals are the largest in the world. It fiendishly scatters allergy-causing pollen from its petals.
Generation III.LeafGreen: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.
